data.title: Uncaught Error: spawn /Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Conte...
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. start Atom for first time ever on OSX 10.11.3
2. Open existing project

**Atom Version**: 1.4.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: spawn /Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom Helper ENOENT

```
At events.js:141

Error: spawn /Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom Helper ENOENT
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:837:11)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:178:32)
    at onErrorNT (internal/child_process.js:344:16)
    at doNTCallback2 (node.js:441:9)
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:355:17)
    at EventEmitter.ipc.sendSync (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom.asar/renderer/api/lib/ipc.js:21:31)
    at BrowserWindow.Object.defineProperty.get [as loadSettings] (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom.asar/renderer/api/lib/remote.js:160:27)
    at Object.windowState (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-load-settings-helpers.js:17:39)
    at Object.stringify (native)
    at exports.setWindowLoadSettings (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-load-settings-helpers.js:27:52)
    at ApplicationDelegate.module.exports.ApplicationDelegate.setRepresentedDirectoryPaths (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/application-delegate.js:172:14)
    at /Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:844:44
    at Function.module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:25:14)
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:125:28)
    at Project.module.exports.Project.addPath (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/project.js:255:29)
    at AtomEnvironment.module.exports.AtomEnvironment.openLocations (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:1029:26)
    at EventEmitter.outerCallback (/Users/hannade/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/application-delegate.js:244:18)
    at emitTwo (events.js:92:20)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:172:7)
```
### Commands

```
     -2:29 application:open (atom-workspace.workspace.scrollbars-visible-always.theme-one-dark-syntax.theme-one-dark-ui)
```
### Config

``` json
{}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
No installed packages

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Cursor Disapears after Alt-TAB
data.body:
I'm on Atom 1.4.0 on Bodhi Linux 3.1.1 (fork of Ubuntu 14.04, trusty), running inside VirtualBox on Windows7. I'm having the exact problem described at the start of Issue #3622.

The [screenshot in the third comment](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3622#issuecomment-56760573) demonstrates my issue exactly. The [workaround described in a later comment](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3622#issuecomment-73421592) did not help (perhaps new Atom has different selectors?).

If I quickly alt-tab back and forth multiple times, I can see the cursor (and the current-line highlight) appears for a few milliseconds, and every about 8 switchings back and forth, the cursor does show correctly.

To note: the cursor just disappears only visibly, but I can still type and I can see the highlight of the line number of the line the cursor is on move when I press Up/Down as well as braces get underlined when I move it horizontally.

data.title: improve docs about grouped settings
data.body:
See https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/698#issuecomment-171725215

Mentioning the grouping feature as "just another type" makes it pretty hard to find. Therefore I moved it into a separate section to make it more obvious.

data.title: Add project Folder is not working on Windows
data.body:
Version 1.40

I licked the â€˜Add Project Folder' on the sidebar, and select a folder.
Nothing was imported in Atom

data.title: Feature Request "TODO" - Line highlight & anycase match
data.body:
Currently when we write a todo comment we must write "todo" in uppercase and only the "todo" is highlighted.

Proposed changes:
1. Accept any combination of case.  "todo", "Todo", "tOdO", etc.
2. Highlight the entire line for better visibility.

data.title: :arrow_up: nodegit@0.9.0
data.body: Most notably pick up https://github.com/nodegit/nodegit/pull/876.

data.title: Installation Has Failed after Editor Crash
data.body:
OS: Windows 10 Pro 32 bit

Yesterday, I installed Atom. It worked, I could use it, but I had to leave for the entire day. So, the next day, I could see a popup saying that Atom has crashed. I tried searching for the Atom application shortcut, but it wasn't there. I thought it wasn't installed properly, then I see an error saying Atom wasn't properly installed.

So, I tried installing it again... Many times. A popup saying "Installation Has Failed" came up:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14261499/12517609/718c3d46-c12b-11e5-8d2f-3bbb2bcd90d8.png)

I even tried running as administrator, but that still didn't work. So I went to check if Task Manager to see if there was anything that could've have caused the error: then I saw, that there were multiple Atom processes running in the background. I started ending them all - one remained running as it was impossible to end.

Then I tried again, and it broke. So then I googled the problem - many were having the same. So then I found out that SquirrelTemp in local AppData may have caused the problem. I tried deleting it, but it says it was being used - probably with the one remaining Atom instance.

I also tried deleting the Atom folder in local AppData, but same problem of it being used came again. Here is what the Setup Log says:

data.title: Menu bar drop down shows up on secondary (left) monitor
data.body:
I have a two monitor setup. Left monitor 22" is the secondary monitor. Right monitor 27" is the primary monitor and where I mostly use Atom.

When the window is in a certain position on the right monitor the drop down menu will be slammed to the very right edge of the left monitor. If I move Atom further from the left monitor the drop down menu will work just fine. If Atom is on the left screen entirely the drop down menu works fine. It seems that about 4" from the very left of the primary monitor the drop down menu works fine. No other applications are doing this. Ran it in safe mode with same results.

The edge of the task bar is the cutoff between the left and right monitors. The drop down menu's are cut off half way at the bottom, I'm pretty sure this is just due to the pressing of the print/screen button; the full menu displays.

Drop down menu showing up on left screen.
![left](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11248197/12502010/c2962b2c-c089-11e5-92ba-abd1cd4e5861.jpg)

Drop down menu showing as it should when Atom is moved further to the right on the right monitor.
![right](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11248197/12502030/ee1a94b8-c089-11e5-83cc-cc34366cc77b.jpg)

OS: Ubuntu 15.10
Desktop: Mate 1.10.2 (Also was happening on KDE Plasma5 same setup)
GPU: nvidia GeForce GTX 550 Ti
Driver: 352.63

Atom: 1.3.1
â”œâ”€â”€ MagicPython@0.5.7
â”œâ”€â”€ kobalt@0.5.0
â”œâ”€â”€ kobalt-ui@0.4.0
â”œâ”€â”€ kobalt-ui-mod@0.4.0
â”œâ”€â”€ language-cisco@1.4.0
â””â”€â”€ latex@0.28.2

data.title: Set Atom to have same number of columns when I reopen it
data.body:
When I close Atom and reopen it, I'm back to 1 column...

Is there any way to permanently set it to show the last columns I had when I closed it? Really annoying having to re-set these when I open it each time...

data.title: odate
Long lines and long Tree View do not show up properly
data.body: When a file gets very long (about 940 characters) or a Tree View has hundreds of file, a glitch prevents further characters or files to show up. They simply are not rendered, leaving the window empty. **Reproduction Steps:** Not sure how to reproduce that issue. At least load an heavy project (several dozen thousand files), or a file with very long lines (happens on unsaved files too, like pasting a very long unprettified JSON output). For the It does not happen consistently but it always happens when I start opening subfolders. For the line, it always happens on long lines. **Screenshots:** | Tree View | Main panel | | --- | --- | | | | Might be 2 different issues but they awfully seem related. Let me know if I should open 2 different issues. **Environment** I'm running Atom 1.4.0 on Mac OS X El Capitan but this was appearing in Atom 1.2.x and 1.3.x as well, I was waiting for 1.4.x to be released before opening an issue. No VM, Shout originally installed via Homebrew Cask and then let it upgrade using Atom's included upgrade mechanism. **Installed packages:** ``` â”œâ”€â”€ atom-jade@0.3.0 â”œâ”€â”€ atom-jinja2@0.5.0 â”œâ”€â”€ change-case@0.6.0 â”œâ”€â”€ emmet@2.4.0 â”œâ”€â”€ file-icons@1.6.14 â”œâ”€â”€ highlight-selected@0.11.1 â”œâ”€â”€ language-diff@0.4.0 â”œâ”€â”€ language-haml@0.23.15 â”œâ”€â”€ language-nginx@0.6.1 â”œâ”€â”€ language-scala@1.1.4 â”œâ”€â”€ merge-conflicts@1.3.7 â”œâ”€â”€ minimap@4.19.0 â”œâ”€â”€ minimap-find-and-replace@4.4.0 â”œâ”€â”€ minimap-git-diff@4.1.8 â”œâ”€â”€ minimap-highlight-selected@4.3.1 â”œâ”€â”€ minimap-pigments@0.1.7 â”œâ”€â”€ minimap-selection@4.3.1 â”œâ”€â”€ pigments@0.20.0 â”œâ”€â”€ pretty-json@0.4.1 â”œâ”€â”€ project-manager@2.7.4 â”œâ”€â”€ react@0.14.1 â”œâ”€â”€ symbol-gen@1.0.0 â””â”€â”€ tab-switcher@1.3.3 ```

data.title: Git status is not directory-relative
data.body:
When working with a directory of git repositories, all git accessories in Atom (including that of plugins) do not find the repository of currently open files.

I would say that it's fair to expect that git tasks, operating on currently opened files etc., would know to search upwards in directories to find the relative git repo. Having a separate atom window for each of my many projects is cumbersome.

Given the layout:

```
/home/projects
    /git-project-1
    /git-project-2
```

Git-related tasks will not function when /home/projects is open in Atom. I would have to open both separately to work on them with the built-in functionality.

data.title: After Clearing the Error in Visualforce Page Still showing In Errors list
data.body: Errors list is not cleared. Especially this is occurs with VF pages, but fine with Apex. how can I clear the errors plane

data.title: Unsaved, untitled buffers discarded when closing window, without prompting; Atom closes non-project space windows when quitting
data.body:
1. Open a new window outside of a project space
2. Write something
3. Quit Atom
4. Reopen Atom
5. It's all gone

And
1. Open a new window in project space
2. Open a new 'untitled' tab
3. Write something
4. Close window
5. It's all gone

Atom should either ask whether you want to save, or keep a backup.  Doing neither is.... simply staggering.

OS X 10.11, Atom 1.4.0.

data.title: Atom 1.4.0 is installed in the future on Windows 8.1
data.body:
I installed Atom 1.4.0 some days ago and today, when I opened the "Uninstall programs" window, I noticed that Atom is has been installed on June 15th 2016.

This is quite akward to have a software installed in the future.
The installation dates of the other softwares are OK.

Screenshot:
![atom_future](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/634461/12481660/ed6ed586-c04a-11e5-9f39-3d6622a9cd71.png)

Configuration: French version of Windows 8.1 Enterprise 64 bits

data.title: "#" character causes issue with syntax coloring
data.body:
Atom version 1.4.0, windows 8 using vmware fusion 7

theme: all theme's I've tested so far include Atom Dark, Atom Material, and One Dark , I've also tested with the corresponding syntaxes. I've also tested with base16 tomorrow syntax. 

Basically what happens is that the color coding of any document (html, JS, ANYTHING) works fine until you include a "#" as part of a string. Once you include it as part of a string all the color coding afterwards is messed up. By messed up I mean that it no longer seems to be able to differentiate between the html element tag, the attribute names, the strings they contain. They are all the same color. 

Below is a screenshot, you can see where it gets messed up on the 10th line where there is a "#".

![screen shot 2016-01-21 at 07 47 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11914897/12480842/37648204-c013-11e5-9009-882e724d7bcc.png)

I've attached another screenshot to show how removing the "#" will fix the issue.

![screen shot 2016-01-21 at 07 48 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11914897/12480875/6c42c2a6-c013-11e5-969d-c0ae7a614f84.png)

my packages: 

C:\Users\Justin Fuller.atom\packages (21)
â”œâ”€â”€ angularjs@0.3.4
â”œâ”€â”€ atom-beautify@0.28.21
â”œâ”€â”€ atom-material-syntax@0.2.10
â”œâ”€â”€ atom-material-ui@0.8.0
â”œâ”€â”€ atom-minify@0.7.1
â”œâ”€â”€ auto-detect-indentation@0.4.2
â”œâ”€â”€ autoclose-html@0.19.0
â”œâ”€â”€ autoprefixer@3.1.0
â”œâ”€â”€ color-picker@2.0.14
â”œâ”€â”€ csscomb@0.3.1
â”œâ”€â”€ file-icons@1.6.14
â”œâ”€â”€ fold-functions@0.4.3
â”œâ”€â”€ highlight-selected@0.11.1
â”œâ”€â”€ KeyCount@0.1.1
â”œâ”€â”€ language-cfml@0.11.0
â”œâ”€â”€ linter@1.11.3
â”œâ”€â”€ linter-csslint@1.2.0
â”œâ”€â”€ linter-htmlhint@1.0.0
â”œâ”€â”€ linter-jshint@1.2.2
â”œâ”€â”€ minimap@4.19.0
â””â”€â”€ minimap-highlight-selected@4.3.1

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: [No because of no theme syntax in safe mode]
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: [Only version i've used]
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: [Yes]
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: [Yes]

This is the first issue I've ever submitted so If I've missed something please just let me know! I put this in this repo since it is happening across all themes, not just a few of them.

data.title: Syntax highlighting for inline HTML
data.body:
As it is to be seen in the screenshot, inlined HTML syntax in Angular components template blocks is not highlighted.
Is there some snippet/package or any existing way to fix this?

![screen shot 2016-01-21 at 10 51 42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7312890/12477028/69f5a3a0-c02d-11e5-84ed-50c729d13586.jpg)

data.title: Opening directory with \..\ does not resolve path name
data.body:
I noticed today that launching Atom on Windows with a folder path including a folder above (`..\`) does not resolve the path name to remove the `..`s, for instance running the command

`atom.exe C:\Users\Mark\Desktop\ProjectFolder\SubFolder\..\SubFolder\File.txt`

Gives a window with the title `C:\Users\Mark\Desktop\ProjectFolder\SubFolder\..\SubFolder\File.txt`:
![atomrelativefolderfile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6715247/12476171/7905114a-c01f-11e5-8dcd-482994e39380.png)

That's not too much of a problem.

However, if you open a directory as a project from the command line with the last part of the path as a `..`, then it gets a bit messier. Running

`atom.exe C:\Users\Mark\Desktop\ProjectFolder\SubFolder\..\`

Opens the `ProjectFolder` as a project, but with the title "..", which isn't so nice.
![atomrelativefolder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6715247/12476255/f5f2d1c4-c01f-11e5-8d88-9f6dab44f624.png)

Could atom check for this and resolve the path/folder name?

A usage case for this is a software project where you want to launch Atom from another the IDE which makes the IDE project path (for instance in the source sub-directory) available as a parameter, but you want to launch the folder above (which contains the documentation directory and source directory) in Atom.

_Tested on Windows 7 64-bit with Atom 1.4.0_

data.title: Close all tabs without closing the window
data.body: Previously, I often hold âŒ˜W to close all tabs. But in 1.4.0 it seems too clever. If you hold âŒ˜W then it will end up closing the window, which I guess is not many people want. Could Atom bring back the old behavior? (Or, am I missing some new shortcut key introduced in 1.4.0?)

data.title: SyntaxError: Unexpected end of input
data.body:
Hello. I haven't done any changes to atom (installing new packages etc) in a while. But today I've got some interesting bug when I opened it. win10
![atom-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6981941/12475467/6b4fc51e-c023-11e5-8355-de81dd702c3c.png)

data.title: Find and Replace in large buffer is very slow
data.body:
It seems to rebuilding tokenized buffer on every operation in transaction.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/400558/12474497/019feaf4-c05f-11e5-94b9-1e07fd3b66fa.png)

It took 16 secs to replace 920 `\n`s to newline on 15-inch MacBook Pro Retina Late-2013.

data.title: Fix auto-indent issue in text editor #10407
data.body:
indentation being changed on paste despite auto indent on paste unchecked. 
#10407

data.title: Moving same file into same pane causes atom to crash
data.body: If I open the same file in two panes (very useful when editing two components of the same file)  and I move the file from one pane to the same pane as the other instance of the file, Atom seemingly kicks into an infinite loop and hangs the host processor.

data.title: Opening multiple windows with the same folder(s) leads to improperly restored state
data.body:
Repro:
1. Open two windows with the same set of folders open.
2. Open different files in each window.
3. Close Atom with `cmd + q`.
4. Restore Atom from the Dock/Finder. Both windows will have the state of one of the previous windows; the other is permanently lost.

I understand this is due to the way Atom saves project state - it appears to be based off a hash of the set of working directories (which is recorded in `~/.atom/storage/application.json`).

I don't have a great proposal about how to fix this; perhaps in the case of multiple windows the hash could include the window index? It seems to be a fairly uncommon use case, anyhow.

data.title: Can't install new atom, old atom disappeared
data.body: On windows 10, Atom 1.4 can't install (Tomorrow I'll post the logs for you). This crash made the old Atom version disappear. All gone.

data.title: Fix open dialog default behavior on Linux
data.body:
Open dialog now defaults to the same directory as the open file, or the user's home directory if there is no file active (such as when viewing the Settings page). This is the convention for gedit and other text editors on Linux. Because of the render/browser process split, this requires async messages to get the path over. The alternative is passing this data when calling application:open, but this requires more extensive changes.

Note: this change is only for linux but it could easily be expanded to other platforms assuming the dialog module works the same way.

Fixes at least #6762
